author: cautiousfox
title: New Member Onboarding
description: Как мы можем ускорить и упростить процесс вступления новых членов Catalyst в соответствующие роли и обязанности в 2022 году?

f6_assessments.q0:
Disclaimer: my view points are shaped by my multi-year experience in product management and software development.

The problem area of onboarding new members is fully in line with Fund 8 objective of growing the number of contributors. 

At the same time, the proposal would be stronger if considered a broder set of Cardano onboarding use cases: onboarding of new developers and app makers.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point because this initiaitve supports only one of three strategic goals of Fund 8.
- 1 point for not considering a broader set of onboarding cases.
My rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
Given the successful growth of Catalyst from fund to fund (the number of proposals, the number of CAs, etc.) the community is well positioned to solve the challenge well.

Out of my own experience as a first-time CA, the current Catalyst onboarding is already good, so improving on the already solid base should be an fully feasible task.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of a discussion about the sufficiency of the requested funds to achieve a noticeable impact.
My rating is 4.
f6_assessments.q2:
Most metrics defined are activity-focused (signups, meeting attendace, numbre of advisors) which should help track some of the progress.

At the same time, considering metrics tracking the targeted impact would make the proposal stronger:
1) % of signed up users who created a proposal.
2) % of proposers receiving high marks.
3) % signed up users who decided to become a CA
4) % new wallets that participate in voting.
5) % of new developers who publish an app within first 6-months
6) the community satisfaction with the onboarding initiatives vs that of competing ecosystems.

I have made the following deductions:
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating the relative impact on the Cardano ecosystem.
- 1 point for the lack of metrics evaluating user satisfaction and the competitiveness of the solutions.
My rating is 3.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge setting is critical indeed to achieve Cardano's mission. I have seen new members getting onboarded that are totally unprepared and have to learn so much before becoming suitable and valuable members in their respective roles. This slows down the process not just for them, but to the people directly around them as they are the ones that have to do the educating. It is good to educate those around you, but it would be more productive if someone took care of that before hand and you can all focus on the task at hand. This challenge setting is also perfectly in line with the strategic goals of Fund 8 in the sense of preparing people willing and able to make contributions to the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The Catalyst community is extremely helpful and kind to each other. They have been onboarding new members every Fund, so it is not something new to them and they know how to help and where to point if someone needs resources. The community have also been building their own workshops and been hosting events with the sole purpose of educating in the specific roles in Catalyst. So YES, this community was made for a Challenge setting like this. There is a team behind this challenge and if they take ownership on its approval this Challenge setting will be efficient from the get go.
f6_assessments.q2: Success criteria are set to create Veterans out of community members in their respective roles. The metrics provided to measure progress in addressing the challenge is divided into 2 sections. General onboarding and the innovation process. Each with individual items that are measurable. Making it easy for proposers to  compare their own metrics and adjust accordingly.

f6_assessments.q0: A challenge to increase participation and contributions by new members aligns with Cardano's mission and one strategic goal. To make the challenge excellent: better articulate how the challenge aligns with more than one of the Fund 8 Strategic Goals.
f6_assessments.q1: There are several challenges that partially overlap in the area of increasing participation by members. As long as the approaches vary and the individual budgets remain moderate, such as this case, the community has capacity to try several approaches in parallel.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria and metrics are measurable and exceptionally well defined.

f6_assessments.q0: The challenge adresses an important  aspect regarding catalyst, the need for increasing quality. Still, a lot of proposal as well as assessments are of low quality. For example, the lack of CAs in relation to the proposals postet in every fund makesit a real challenge to confidently assess all of the proposals. CA onboarding for example would help both Catalyst and Cardanos mission in general. Since I consider the societal impact of Project Catalyst to be quite high, This challenge also has the potential to produce positive societal impact.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge is open enough while it still has very concrete metrics, so it enables a variety of good solutions. The challenge team seems competent and clearly knows what they are talking about. It is reasonable to expect proposals being delivered in a timely manner for this well-defined, feasible challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics are concrete, addressable and make sense for the challenge. In general, they should enable quality, auditable proposals.

importance: Успех программы Catalyst зависит от наличия качественных команд, авторов предложений, консультантов, наставников и избирателей.
success: Хорошо отлаженная платформа открытых инноваций, где люди выполняют значимые для них роли и вносят свой вклад в общий успех.
